pull.title: doc: Remove outdated qt4 install information from README.md
pull.body:
This text is aimed at users installing the binaries.

Now that Qt5 is linked statically, there is no need to install Qt as a run-time dependency.

Needs backport to 0.12.x.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.message:
doc: Remove outdated qt4 install information from README.md

This text is aimed at users installing the binaries.

Now that Qt5 is linked statically, there is no need to install Qt
as a run-time dependency.
doc: 32 and 64 bit packages are seperate

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -11,17 +11,11 @@ The following are some helpful notes on how to run Bitcoin on your native platfo
 
 ### Unix
 
-You need the Qt4 run-time libraries to run Bitcoin-Qt. On Debian or Ubuntu:
-
-	sudo apt-get install libqtgui4
-
 Unpack the files into a directory and run:
 
 - bin/32/bitcoin-qt (GUI, 32-bit) or bin/32/bitcoind (headless, 32-bit)
comments.body:
There is no `bin/32`?

There are different tars for each arch?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -11,17 +11,11 @@ The following are some helpful notes on how to run Bitcoin on your native platfo

comments.body: Yes, good catch, that needs updating too.
